Richard also gets behind the wheel of the BMW M5, which is powered by a twin-turbo V8 engine instead of the high-revving V10 of its predecessor.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme River Challenge

As he concludes his trek in the river's coastal reaches, he faces a crisis of conscience as he witnesses a traditional crocodile hunt.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway, manager Stephen Greig is trying to ensure that all goes to plan ahead of the opening of the new station at Caernarfon.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.desc: Forgotten relics from the defence of America's homeland, concealed by the banks of the Mississippi, and a concrete behemoth on the French coast that proved invulnerable to attacks.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett examines the impact of the conquest of Britain and Ireland, and learns how William the Conqueror built scores of castles and cathedrals to impose his control and intimidate the population. The ruler also commissioned the Domesday Book to survey the wealth of the land and raise revenue, and set in motion the linguistic and cultural transformation of England. The Normans blended well in Scotland, but faced fierce opposition in Wales, and promoted divisions in Ireland which some claim still exist to this day.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into some of the events in the Bible, beginning with the story of the Ten Plagues. In the Old Testament, the Book of Exodus describes the epic battle between the prophet Moses and Pharaoh. Experts offer various various explanations for the 10 plagues of Moses and the mass exodus of the Hebrew slaves out of Egypt, a story that is a cornerstone of the Jewish, Christian, and Muslim faiths.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Chief Curator at Historic Royal Palaces, Dr Tracy Borman travels to Germany to uncover Nazi Party leader Adolf Hitler's abusive childhood and artistic aspirations. programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Dr Tracy Borman travels to St Petersburg, to reveal how Emperor Peter the Great's unconventional childhood produced a very unconventional man - from the debauched drinking society that governed Russia to his collection of oddities in the Kunstkamera museum. She also discovers how the enlightened yet brutal Peter managed to drag Russia towards the modern age.

programme.title: Private Lives

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a railway trip across Canada, revealing how 2,500 miles of transcontinental railway was built against huge odds in just a few decades, helping to join together a vast wilderness of isolated communities and create the country that exists today. He begins his journey on one of the earliest sections of track to be built, on a train that is now a lifeline for hunters and fishermen. He then sees one of the biggest, most famous trains in the world - the Canadian, before heading for the Prairies, and on to the port of Vancouver. Along the way he also searches for Winnie the Pooh, crosses raging rivers and meets the descendant of a pioneering Yorkshire family who arrived here more than 100 years ago.

programme.desc: Part two of two. As Neil is hauled into custody on a murder charge, mutual mistrust begins to brew between the Sun Hill regulars and the National Crime Squad team led by Mickey Webb. Ever resourceful, Neil pretends to have hard evidence that a corrupt copper is responsible for his predicament - deliberately provoking an attempt on his own life as a way of proving his innocence.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Lola's daughter Cleo borrows the car against her mother's wishes, and is later rushed to hospital after being involved in a crash. Diane urges Dean to be realistic about his limitations as a surgeon. However, this makes him more determined than ever to prove his worth - to the point of diagnosing patients unsupervised and administering unauthorised treatments.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Mark is suspected of stealing drugs from the department, pressure mounts on Penny, and Sam gets a shock while prying into Lee's private life. Meanwhile, Tina surprises herself by asking Sean for a date. Starring Paterson Joseph and Jonathan Kerrigan.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Margaret falls down a flight of stairs during a tussle with an increasingly harassed Ramani, who has become convinced she's being stalked. Neil returns to Sun Hill, and Yvonne agrees to a date with nurse Nick, only to leave him in the lurch. Samantha and Terry find themselves in a room full of venomous snakes, while Gina faces an ordeal of a different kind as she prepares to start chemotherapy.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Clyde keeps getting himself into trouble, while Frank continues to try to win Pat over.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The locals are attending a football match and Arthur comes close to having his secret relationship with Mrs Hewitt found out by Pauline.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Sicknote performs a heroic rescue for a mother and baby trapped in an attic flat. Meanwhile, Recall returns to duty now that Jamie is getting better.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: The sale of Glenbogle's biggest mountain for a development of holiday cottages causes a major rift between Stella and Archie, but the most sinister threat comes in the form of entrepreneur Stuart McIntosh who has his eye on both the land and Lexie. Richard Briers, Alastair Mackenzie and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim is drawn into a serious family dispute by an American woman who believes her father murdered her mother and wants him deported back to Florida to stand trial. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Jack inherits his deceased employer's bad-tempered dog. Billy, meanwhile, is keen to discover if blondes do have more fun.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: With no sign of Jeffrey Fairbrother, Ted is summoned to Head Office, and jumps to the conclusion that he is about to be made entertainments manager. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy's policeman boyfriend calls at the house with important news and Alistair suddenly realises he wants to settle down, but he can't decide what should come first - work or romance. Starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Romance Springs a Leak
programme.desc: When Hobbo learns that Howard feels he is taken for granted by Pearl and that Toby misses his former wife, he hatches a plan to sort out their love lives - with the help of flowers, a Mario Lanza recording and his own team of miming violinists.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Havers returns to work and is forced to confront demons from her past as the team investigates the case of a woman murdered with a shotgun. A cryptic word painted at the crime scene and the discovery of a mysterious photo lead the police to think the killer is sending them clues, and further investigations uncover a secret the local community has been trying to hide.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack and Strickland form an unlikely alliance that sees them break the rules to find out why a British soldier died while taking part in a Ministry of Defence medical trial. With three of the man's colleagues now suffering from psychological, drink or memory problems, the team considers whether he died as a result of the experiment, or if he was a victim of a cover-up by the Army.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. A recently released convict comes under suspicion when a warden at his parole hostel is murdered. However, when the cold case squad become involved, it transpires the former prisoner may have been the intended target rather than the perpetrator, and that this killing may be connected to previous unsolved crimes. Nigel Terry and Kerry Fox guest star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Margaret falls down a flight of stairs during a tussle with an increasingly harassed Ramani, who has become convinced she's being stalked. Neil returns to Sun Hill, and Yvonne agrees to a date with nurse Nick, only to leave him in the lurch. programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Sicknote performs a heroic rescue for a mother and baby trapped in an attic flat. Meanwhile, Recall returns to duty now that Jamie is getting better.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits a Japanese-style horticultural haven in St Mawgan, Cornwall - open to the public under the National Gardens Scheme - complete with oriental plants including bamboo and bonsai.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: A woman's corpse is discovered in a ploughed field, and the only lead is her husband, a potter. A year earlier, he suddenly decided to start a new life as a monk, suggesting that his wife may have committed suicide because she could not bear to lose him to the brethren - or that her spouse may have had a hand in her death. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The Rev Harry Nettles bets the antiques dealer that a field next to a church contains a Roman mosaic. Drama, guest starring David Kossoff, with Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer's teenage daughter goes missing, while an MP's son develops a profitable sideline in forged paintings. Drama, starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Humiliated that Sir Henry Simmerson has allowed the French to make off with an English standard, Sharpe vows to make amends by capturing the most jealously guarded battlefield prize of them all - a French eagle emblem touched by the hand of Napoleon himself. Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley and Brian Cox star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Work at Thornley Manor is over and the lads take a break before leaving for Spain. Oz uses the opportunity to visit home and hits on the barmy idea of kidnapping his son, determined to prevent him from being taken overseas by his wife Marjorie - but makes the mistake of roping Wayne in to help.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Tempers fray as the boys' flight to Spain is postponed, so Ally Fraser tries to calm things down by inviting them all back to his flash residence for drinks - where Wayne's libido soon leads him into trouble. With Jimmy Nail, Gary Holton and Bill Paterson.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Horticultural lecturer Rosemary Boxer is hired by a wealthy but ill businessman to help cure a disease causing his trees to lose their bark. She gets to know Laura Thyme, who turns up after a friend is killed in a suspicious car accident, and when the pair find the lord of the manor unconscious beneath his bedroom window, they must decide whether depression led him to attempt suicide or if there is a more sinister explanation. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal, Pam Ferris, David Mallinson and Roger Alborough.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths uncover the remains of a racehorse while engaged on horticultural work in the grounds of pop star Nev Connolly's supposedly haunted mansion. Before long, gruesome revelations are coming thick and fast as Nev is shot dead and more bones are discovered - this time belonging to a young woman. As they investigate further, Rosemary and Laura are plunged into a sinister mystery with roots deep in the past. Drama, guest starring Murray Head (Heartbeat) and Abigail Cruttenden (Benidorm).

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are asked to restore an ornate water garden cascade in the grounds of a health spa, where they are invited to join owner Frances Caldecott and her children for dinner. That evening, the duo discover Frances has been strangled and her jewellery stolen, and set out to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Shepherd and his team are confronted with the sight of a Santa Claus with a slit throat. The victim is actually much-loved local mayor Evan Whitestone, who had dressed as Santa every year for the Christmas parade. Suspicion soon turns to the four rivals for his mayoral chains in a forthcoming election. Neill Rea and Fern Sutherland star.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch helps an Italian detective recover a shipload of stolen antiquities and Brackenreid considers shipping out altogether.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Sequel to hit fantasy drama Life on Mars. Alex Drake, a single mother working as a police psychologist in 2008 is shocked to wake up in London in 1981 after being shot. DCI Gene Hunt, DS Ray Carling and DC Chris Skelton, transferred to the Met, swiftly come to her rescue. She knows all about the trio having spent months reading Sam Tyler's reports of his time in the past, but cannot understand why she is sharing his delusion. Starring Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: DCI Hunt is determined nothing will spoil Diana Spencer's wedding, and so sets out to prevent a potentially explosive protest getting out of hand. When it seems Thatcherite playboy Danny is in danger, Alex is assigned to look after him - but after a speedy ride in a DeLorean leaves her in no fit state for work, Gene and Ray set out to crack the case. Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes star.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A woman asks Kavanagh to ensure justice is done on behalf of her husband, who died on the operating table in mysterious circumstances - despite the surgeon's claims that he was alive and well when she stitched him up. As if that were not a tough enough assignment, the redoubtable barrister also faces the task of convincing son Matt that failing his A levels is not the end of the world. John Thaw stars with his real-life wife Sheila Hancock, Josette Simon, Lisa Harrow and Tom Brodie.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Robert's brother Frank comes to stay - and presents the private detective with another intriguing case in the final episode of the light-hearted drama. The daughter of Frank's old flame has gone missing from her new job in a Victorian heritage museum and early investigations indicate that Marianne was last seen running out of the museum in her school mistress costume, following a row with the manager.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Now that Hetty and her husband are back from their trip to Australia, the Wainthropp Detective Agency can get back to some serious sleuthing. However, the first case to crop up is far from typical - it involves hunting for buried treasure in the wilds of Cumbria. Patricia Routledge stars as the modern-day Miss Marple, with Derek Benfield, Dominic Monaghan and Lesley Dunlop.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: A pretender to the throne is held captive at court, confounding the Tudors, and creating a new rift in Lizzie and King Henry's marriage. Lizzie faces an impossible choice, and makes a risky move to try to eliminate the threat to her family. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron agrees to help trace Millie Calm's real mother, but soon wishes he had never got involved. Rural medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Neil's world begins to collapse around his ears when his meeting with a key witness in the money laundering trial is followed by her attempted kidnapping. Already paranoid after discovering a bug in his house and an intruder rummaging through his rubbish, the confused copper begins to wonder if somebody's trying to frame him - and his suspicions are confirmed when he's beaten up, drugged and awakes to find himself next to a murdered man.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Tilly Trotter
programme.desc: Period drama about a 19-year-old woman, who is attacked after an engagement party in honour of a farmer for whom she has feelings. Carli Norris stars.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Tilly Trotter
programme.desc: Following the destruction of their home by the McGraths, Tilly and her grandmother are forced to live a life of solitude. Period drama, starring Carli Norris.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy try to grant Sam his final wish and sneak him out of his sick-bed for a secret rendezvous - but when he drops dead, things begin to get out of hand. Feature-length Christmas special from 1983, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth receives a cryptic letter from a recently deceased acquaintance asking her to conduct a mysterious investigation. Instructed only to go on a coach tour of historic homes around England, she uncovers murder and intrigue. Feature-length mystery, starring Joan Hickson, with Peter Tilbury, John Horsley and Helen Cherry.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Reid and Ross investigate the discovery of a mutilated body on a remote island, but find the locals strangely uncommunicative and struggle to make headway. Back in Glasgow, Burke and Fraser link the victim to a drugs operation thanks to a tattoo on his arm - but just as their investigation appears to be on the right track, a mysterious disappearance complicates the case still further.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Burke promises to help an old flame working for a politician who is in trouble for accepting funds from an underworld figure. The investigation into the criminal leads Burke to a shady escort agency, but the case and his reputation are jeopardised when he is caught on camera leaving the building after a raid by vice officers. Detective drama, starring Alex Norton.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: Joe's future in the army hangs in the balance, as Honor struggles to cope with the revelations about his secret past. Markham is torn between his duty and his conscience, while Armstrong fears for Yusra's safety.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The pretender exposes King Henry's weaknesses, while Lizzie confronts new demons and old curses. Concluding the sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages as the War of the Roses comes to an end. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry is forced to confront his past when the team reinvestigates the 33-year-old murder of a doctor whose body was found hanging from a meat hook on a butcher's stall at Smithfield Market. The butcher had gone missing on the same day, and since then the community has rallied to help his widow keep the business afloat. However, his recently discovered remains reveal a match to an unidentified person and lead to a shocking revelation for Sandra. Guest starring Ken Farrington, David Calder and Diana Quick, with Amanda Redman and Alun Armstrong.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Brad Connor is devastated to learn he may be HIV positive, and makes a drunken pass at Marsha Stubbs. Joy Wilton discovers the joys of mixing work with pleasure.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gary investigates the alleged rape of a 13-year-old girl and discovers she lied about her age. At his urging, the accused confess to sex, hoping to be treated leniently - only to end up facing a possible life sentence. Honey's fiance Scott Burnett is arrested for murdering his wife, while Ramani is interrogated by Adam and Gina about events leading up to Margaret Barnes' fall - and suffers the added trauma of learning Roger has accused her of deliberately causing the incident.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Donna's past comes back to haunt her when she meets the teenager who asked her for an abortion pill a few weeks earlier. It transpires the girl is now pregnant again, and her mother shows up at the hospital to find out exactly what's going on. Matters are further complicated when Owen learns she is only 15 years old - and also discovers how the nurses falsified her records. Meanwhile, Connie begins to lose patience with Elliot.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Amy brings baby Milo to see everyone on her way home. Meanwhile, Eve and Gerry want to throw Frank out when they catch him about to take drugs in the toilets.

programme.title: The Bill

programme.desc: Jack is questioned about Vicki's disappearance as the search for her intensifies.

programme.desc: A routine inspection of a theatre ends in tragedy when a lighting rig falls on top of Colin. Elsewhere, Hallam considers taking on a job outside the brigade.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim investigates corporate scandals on Jersey while Danielle grows convinced his life is in danger, but nobody will believe her. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian's poetry is to be published, much to the delight of his Italian girlfriend. Joeys and Jack's love lives, however, are in deep trouble.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Ted has a chance of stardom when he is hired as a late replacement at an uptown show for a fellow comedian. It is rumoured that talent scouts from the TV show Opportunity Knocks will be in the audience. Classic comedy following life at Maplin's holiday camp, starring Paul Shane, Su Pollard and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.sub-title: The World Will Always Welcome Lovers
programme.desc: The truth about Alistair's wedding nerves is revealed after he and Lionel spill the beans, but Rocky comes to the rescue to ensure the ceremony finally takes place. Jean refuses to give up on her efforts to play Cupid between Harry and Sandy.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Hobbo discovers that an infirm friend needs help to bury his pet in the churchyard, and calls on Alvin and Entwistle to carry out the deed. programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The mismatched detectives investigate the murder of businessman Richard Mattis and discover a family tormented by sinister secrets. A second body found in the canal behind Mattis's factory makes matters even more puzzling. Warren Clarke, Colin Buchanan and Alison Steadman star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack examines a case previously undertaken by a deceased colleague, who was convinced that the alleged suicide of a journalist was a cover-up by the American government. Guest starring Mark Williams, Glynis Barber, Michael Brandon and Raquel Cassidy, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. A man admitted to hospital after a traffic accident turns out to be one of two children who disappeared without trace 15 years previously. Detective drama, starring Trevor Eve.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti
programme.desc: Part two of two. Joanna completes her Cuban journey by visiting the infamous town of Guantanamo. Giving the prison a wide berth, she discovers that the song Guantanamera was born in the town, and meets a talented young singer who is recording the track herself. She then heads across the Windward Passage to Haiti, currently the poorest country in the Western World. She visits the Citadel, a mighty fortress built to deter colonial powers, before taking in a Voodoo ceremony on the Iles a Vaches.

programme.desc: Drama about the secrets and dishonour among the upper echelons of 19th-century London society, adapted by Julian Fellowes from his novel of the same name. The year is 1836 and the Trenchard family have recently ascended to the aristocratic society of London's Belgravia - only for a 26-year-old love affair to come back to haunt them and jeopardise the happiness of many. Starring Tamsin Greig, Philip Glenister and Harriet Walter.

Meanwhile, Neil and Kelly embrace what was broadcast and pretend that they are lottery winners, and later, Maggie discovers the truth about Dr Carol's marriage. programme.title: Australian Wilderness with Ray Mears
programme.desc: Ray heads deep into the Australian Outback discover how both people and animals have developed ways to thrive in otherwise challenging conditions. He begins in Western Australia, where 20 million years ago, the sea bed erupted to create the great limestone cliffs of Ningaloo. Amid the rocks, the presenter encounters the fossils of giant prehistoric sharks, before swimming with their modern descendants - the whale sharks - out on Ningaloo reef.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: The UK is on the brink of a coronavirus epidemic and, with over-65s deemed particularly at risk, Geraint Vincent asks how the general public can protect the elderly from it. The older you get, the greater the chances that the virus could be fatal. Tonight explores why this is and which underlying conditions make people especially vulnerable. With the help of doctors and scientists, Geraint provides specialist advice on what to do if you or a relative has symptoms, tips on how to protect each other from infection, and what to do if you are elderly and told to self-isolate. How are hospitals preparing for what may now be inevitable rises in elderly admissions, and can an already-stretched care system cope? Should we avoid contact with our elderly relatives or should we carry on as normal? With the latest figures, top experts and government advice, the film provides the ultimate guide on how we can protect the elderly from this fast-moving virus.

programme.title: The Station: Trouble on the Tracks
programme.desc: Euston is evacuated during Friday rush hour - leaving passengers there and in Birmingham New Street station stranded, confused and angry. Driver Andy reveals just how close his train came to disaster on the tracks and train dispatcher and former bank manager David imparts his worldly wisdom to a new recruit on his first shift. A train runs a red signal at Birmingham, so engineers have to work through the night to move the stranded locomotive, investigate the cause and get things back up and running before the morning rush.

programme.sub-title: Sacrifice at the Edge of Time
programme.desc: Po decides it's time to figure out a way to defeat Jindiao once and for all before time runs out..

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Mavis gives Hank a basketball.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Cookery show presented by John Torode and Lisa Faulkner, featuring recipes, shortcuts, inspiration and tips. The first episode features spring roast chicken, a fruity curry, Victoria sponge, cheat's raspberry jam and easy cheese scones, and a simple souffle.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott embarks on a journey across the Mediterranean on a 44ft catamaran, preparing a variety of delicious recipes along the way. In this first edition, skipper Jean-Hughes teaches him the basics of sailing, and they drop anchor in a crystal-clear cove on the island of Lavezzi, where Ainsley tries his hand at paddle-boarding. The chef then prepares seafood skewers with pepperonata, and a quick and tasty Corsican mint omelette.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The expert walker chooses her favourite, most accessible family treks in search of the perfect walk with a view that anyone can tackle in a morning or afternoon ramble, venturing off the beaten track and discovering some of Britain's most breath-taking scenery.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the second Knockout round, as 12 acts perform for a place in the live semi-final. Coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor are in the red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions and the Battle Rounds fight for a place on their coach's team.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo return with another edition of the Saturday evening variety show. Tom Jones will be taking to the stage to perform on this week's End of The Show Show, while Bradley Walsh becomes the first repeat victim of Undercover when Ant and Dec invade an episode of The Chase. Plus, keep an eye out for Fleur East, who has another Place on the Plane to give away.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Schoolteacher Connie Bishop keeps waking in the night, convinced she has an intruder, but most of the villagers in Badger's Drift dismiss her fears as an overactive imagination. Days later, a local councillor thought to have been obsessed with her is found murdered in her garden, and the ensuing investigation by Barnaby and Jones uncovers jealous rivals, ruthless social climbers and a cottage with a few secrets. Guest starring Paul Kaye, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking Strictly head judge Shirley Ballas, actress Bhavna Limbachia and This Morning's resident GP Dr Ranj Singh to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. The players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for their chosen charities.

programme.title: The Family Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a family-themed edition of the game show. Here, instead of teaming up with strangers, the Hartes from Co Antrim work alongside their family members as they pit their general-knowledge know-how against one of the finest quiz brains in the country.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: A medical train rolls into town, providing miracle surgeries and carrying a surprise for Gabriel - a glamorous older surgeon from his past. While he is reminiscing with his old colleague, a vicious attack on one of the team shocks the medics and leaves Lydia reeling, and an elderly British man arrives in India on a romantic mission. Can the doctors help him in his quest? Medical drama set in southern India, starring Amanda Redman, James Krishna Floyd, Neil Morrissey and Amrita Acharia, with a guest appearance by Kenneth Cranham.

credits.actor: a guest appearance by Kenneth Cranham

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: Anne decides that honesty is required, and hopes that seeking confession with Caroline will appease her guilt and lay to rest the ghosts from her past. However, she has sorely underestimated Lady Brockenhurst, who sets about unearthing the secrets that bind the families together. Hosting a prestigious dinner party, she invites a special guest whose presence reveals a deceit James Trenchard would wish to keep private.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti
programme.desc: Part two of two. Joanna completes her Cuban journey by visiting the infamous town of Guantanamo. Giving the prison a wide berth, she discovers that the song Guantanamera was born in the town, and meets a talented young singer who is recording the track herself. She then heads across the Windward Passage to Haiti, currently the poorest country in the Western World. She visits the Citadel, a mighty fortress built to deter colonial powers, before taking in a Voodoo ceremony on the Iles a Vaches.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Peter Cole is worried about the press interest following Maggie's interview and the online petition calling for his resignation over the scandal. Meanwhile, Alex is greeted at work by two money lenders, who have found him because his girlfriend Roxanna's picture appeared in the papers. Author Marcus Ormansby gives a talk at the school, and finds that romance is blossoming between him and Jill. Later, Maggie's visit to Kelly's salon is tense, but they have a heart to heart, leading Kelly to return home to husband Neil and take action over their 'lottery' money.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five family and friends answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and topical studio discussion from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder's Crime Stories
programme.desc: Robert Rinder examines the murders of police officers Nicola Hughes and Fiona Bone in 2012, hearing about their fathers' efforts to fundraise in their daughters' memories.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five family members from Dunstable answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Becky, Sue, Jonny and Simon pit their wits against a ruthless quiz genius in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: The sunny summer season continues, as the Richardsons celebrate a christening at the Cathedral, Jeremy and Stuart have a big performance and Dean Sarah has her portrait painted. Siriol Jenkins narrates.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: As the investigation takes a shocking turn, secrets rise to the surface. When Andrew was living in Edinburgh, a strange turn of events brought him face to face with an old acquaintance, whose deeply corrosive influence becomes clear. Meanwhile, the tragic recent history of Laura's family helps explain the deep bond she and Katy share, as well as the lengths Laura will go to for those she loves. Will her past catch up with her, just as Andrew's did? Thriller, starring Ioan Gruffudd and Joanne Froggatt.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Serial Killer with Piers Morgan
programme.desc: The broadcaster meets Bronx businessman Alex Henriquez, who was convicted for three murders in 1992. The victims had two things in common - they were all asphyxiated before being dumped by the highway and all three could be placed with Alex Henriquez shortly before their deaths. For 30 years the killer has protested his innocence, claiming the police set him up. Piers Morgan tries to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Trish returns to the scene of the crime in the hope it will prompt her to remember something more about the attack, while DC Katie Harford thinks she has a strong lead when she discovers a new suspect who doesn't have an alibi. Cath reveals interesting new information about the night of her party, while a match is made for the male DNA found on Trish. An unknown woman walks into the police station - and delivers some devastating new information when interviewed by Ellie and Hardy. Crime drama, starring David Tennant, Olivia Colman and Julie Hesmondhalgh.

programme.title: Scotland Revealed Moments
programme.desc: Aerial views of the Cairngorms, presented by Vanessa Collingridge.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike and Ant reminisce about the experiences they have had in the series, including bonus footage, hilarious outtakes, and fascinating processes.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Steve heads to the Top End where a monsoon has swept away roads and created an inland sea. Later, a Perth heavy haulage crew moves a huge pedestrian bridge.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The crew struggles to move a large new press into the shop and Paul Teutul Sr pushes the team to risk a bold design.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Mike thought his 1967 Chevy K10 Pick Up needed paint improvement, but Dan realises it requires even more. Harry loves his 1970 Opel Kadett, but it's a struggle finding parts.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe takes on a succession of unpleasant tasks, this time exploring the depths of Pit 91 before travelling north to find out how much of an animal can be recycled.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look at how customised knee replacements, leaf springs and lavender oil are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Cast Iron Stoves/Ultralight Aircraft/Snow Groomers/Rubber Bands
programme.desc: The development of manufacturing processes behind cast Iron stoves, ultralight aircraft, snow groomers and rubber bands.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacture of delicious baklava, favourite sweet of the Ottomans. Plus, James Bond's gyroplane, the ukulele, and the Supercat - the world's fastest ferry.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel across the UK to find unique and valuable items languishing in people's homes and use creative thinking and elbow grease to fix them up to turn a profit for their owners. Here they unearth a church pew, create a fish tank from scrap and uncover a special petrol tank.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Tempers flare as the crews run into difficulties, but a change of course promises to transform their fortunes.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: As Nome Harbour freezes over, the crews head out one final time, and it is a battle of the barges when Hank and Shawn bet on who can box the most gold.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Stripped Down
programme.desc: Mike is excited to find a classic 1950s Ford pick-up truck with a unique charm. Back at the garage, Edd is less than impressed with the amount of work the rust-bucket needs..

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer buys a run-down Porsche 928, which leaves Edd China doubtful about their chances of getting the car back on the road again.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer meets the proud owner of a Porsche 928 which is in good condition, while Edd China adds the finishing touches to the restoration project.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini takes a Chrysler CG Imperial LeBaron Dual Cowl Phaeton to Kuwait's Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini enthuses about a 1931 Ford Model A Starlite coupe hot rod that won the Autoram as it goes under auction without a reserve.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel across the UK to find unique and valuable items languishing in people's homes and use creative thinking and elbow grease to fix them up to turn a profit for their owners. Here they unearth a church pew, create a fish tank from scrap and uncover a special petrol tank.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: Darrell Miklos visits the Atocha, a valuable shipwreck Cooper recorded 50 years ago, and experts send him to an archive in Spain to hunt down an ancient manifest.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A planned reduction in the price of king crab sets the crews racing to complete their quotas and maximise their earnings, but in-fighting and a major storm hamper their progress.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: Miners risk their lives diving below the ice on the frozen Bering Sea for a fortune in gold. While one nearly loses his life, another hits his biggest payday ever.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard explores an Aladdin's cave of magic carpets in Cumbria and royal biographer Colin Campbell reveals antiques with tragic history from her romantic castle.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
